intro: Fumana glutinosa var. laevis, commonly known as the smooth sticky fumana, is a variant of the fumana plant characterized by its smooth, glabrous surfaces. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in temperate regions. Its sticky secretions have been noted for their potential medicinal and ecological significance.
